title: List Directory Contents
description: Displays a list of files and subdirectories in a directory.

title: Change Directory
description: Changes the current directory. Use 'cd ..' to go up one level, 'cd /' to go to root.

title: Clear Screen
description: Clears the command prompt screen.

title: Copy Files
description: Copies one or more files to another location.

title: Move Files
description: Moves files from one directory to another.

title: Delete Files
description: Deletes one or more files. Use '/s' to delete from all subdirectories.

title: Remove Directory
description: Removes a directory. Use '/s' to remove directory tree, '/q' for quiet mode.

title: Create Directory
description: Creates a new directory or subdirectory.

title: View File Contents
description: Displays the contents of a text file.

title: Rename Files
description: Renames a file or directory.

title: Find Text in Files
description: Searches for strings in files. Use '/s' to search in current directory and all subdirectories.

title: Display System Information
description: Displays detailed configuration information about a computer and its operating system.

title: Check IP Configuration
description: Displays all current TCP/IP network configuration values. Use '/all' for detailed information.

title: Release IP Address
description: Discards the current DHCP configuration for all adapters.

title: Renew IP Address
description: Renews DHCP configuration for all adapters.

title: Flush DNS Cache
description: Purges the DNS Resolver cache.

title: Test Network Connectivity
description: Sends ICMP echo request packets to test network connectivity. Use '-t' for continuous ping.

title: Trace Network Route
description: Traces the route packets take to a network host.

title: Display Network Statistics
description: Displays active TCP connections, ports, and statistics. Use '-a' for all connections, '-n' for numeric.

title: Display ARP Cache
description: Displays and modifies the IP-to-Physical address translation tables.

title: Task List
description: Displays a list of currently running processes. Use '/v' for verbose, '/svc' for services.

title: End Process
description: Terminates tasks by process id. Use '/im' to kill by image name.

title: Disk Usage
description: Checks a disk and displays a status report. Use '/f' to fix errors, '/r' to locate bad sectors.

title: Format Disk
description: Formats a disk for use with Windows. Use '/fs' to specify file system.

title: Disk Partition Management
description: Starts the Disk Partition utility for managing disks, partitions, and volumes.

title: File System Check
description: Scans and repairs Windows system files.

title: Check Disk for Errors
description: Checks the status of all disk drives in the system.

title: Display Windows Version
description: Displays the Windows version number.

title: Display Current Date
description: Displays or sets the system date.

title: Display Current Time
description: Displays or sets the system time.

title: Set Environment Variable
description: Sets or displays environment variables for the current session.

title: List Environment Variables
description: Displays all environment variables for the current session.

title: Path Environment Variable
description: Displays the PATH environment variable.

title: Command History
description: Displays all commands entered in the current session.

title: Help for Commands
description: Provides help information for Windows commands.

title: Command Syntax Help
description: Displays help for a specific command.

title: Shut Down Computer
description: Shuts down the computer immediately. Use '/r' for restart, '/l' for logoff.

title: Restart Computer
description: Restarts the computer immediately.

title: Schedule Shutdown
description: Schedules a shutdown after specified seconds.

title: Abort Shutdown
description: Aborts a system shutdown.

title: Force Shutdown
description: Forces running applications to close and shuts down the computer.

title: Windows Update History
description: Lists all installed Windows updates.

title: Check Windows License
description: Displays the expiration date of the current Windows license.

title: Activate Windows
description: Activates Windows using the existing product key.

title: Display Product Key
description: Retrieves the Windows product key from the BIOS.

title: Event Viewer Logs
description: Opens the Event Viewer to examine Windows logs.

title: Resource Monitor
description: Opens the Resource Monitor to view system resource usage.

title: System Configuration
description: Opens the System Configuration utility for boot and startup management.

title: Device Manager
description: Opens the Device Manager to manage hardware devices.

title: Disk Management
description: Opens the Disk Management console.

title: Services Management
description: Opens the Services management console.

title: Local Group Policy
description: Opens the Local Group Policy Editor (Windows Pro/Enterprise only).

title: Registry Editor
description: Opens the Registry Editor for modifying Windows registry.

title: Windows Features
description: Opens Windows Features dialog to enable/disable Windows components.

title: Remote Desktop
description: Opens Remote Desktop Connection client.

title: Command Prompt as Admin
description: Opens Command Prompt with administrator privileges.

title: PowerShell
description: Opens Windows PowerShell.

title: PowerShell as Admin
description: Opens PowerShell with administrator privileges.

title: Windows Version Info
description: Displays the About Windows dialog with version information.

title: System Properties
description: Opens System Properties dialog.

title: Network Connections
description: Opens Network Connections control panel.

title: Power Options
description: Opens Power Options control panel.

title: Date and Time
description: Opens Date and Time properties.

title: Sound Settings
description: Opens Sound settings control panel.

title: Display Settings
description: Opens Display settings control panel.

title: Mouse Properties
description: Opens Mouse Properties control panel.

title: Keyboard Properties
description: Opens Keyboard Properties control panel.

title: User Accounts
description: Opens User Accounts management dialog.

title: Add User
description: Creates a new user account.

title: Delete User
description: Deletes a user account.

title: List Users
description: Lists all user accounts on the system.

title: Change User Password
description: Changes password for a user account.

title: Add User to Group
description: Adds a user to a local group.

title: List Groups
description: Lists all local groups on the system.

title: Display Computer Name
description: Displays the name of the computer.

title: Change Computer Name
command: wmic computersystem where name="%computername%" call rename name="<new_name>"
description: Changes the computer name (requires restart).

title: System Uptime
description: Shows when the system was last booted.

title: Check Port Availability
description: Checks if a specific port is in use.

title: List All Listening Ports
description: Lists all ports that are currently listening for connections.

title: Find Process Using Port
description: Finds which process is using a specific port.

title: Display Routing Table
description: Displays the IP routing table.

title: Add Static Route
description: Adds a static route to the routing table.

title: Delete Route
description: Deletes a route from the routing table.

title: List Shared Folders
description: Lists all shared folders on the computer.

title: Create Shared Folder
description: Creates a network share for a folder.

title: Delete Shared Folder
description: Deletes a network share.

title: Display Current User
description: Displays the current username.

title: Display User Privileges
description: Displays the privileges of the current user.

title: Display User Groups
description: Displays the groups the current user belongs to.

title: List All Processes
description: Lists all running processes with their IDs.

title: Find Process by Name
description: Finds processes by name.

title: Display Service Status
description: Displays the status of a specific service.

title: Start Service
description: Starts a Windows service.

title: Stop Service
description: Stops a Windows service.

title: Pause Service
description: Pauses a Windows service.

title: Continue Service
description: Resumes a paused Windows service.

title: Create New Service
description: Creates a new Windows service.

title: Delete Service
description: Deletes a Windows service.

title: Display Service Configuration
description: Displays the configuration of a service.

title: Display Installed Drivers
description: Lists all installed device drivers.

title: Display Driver Details
description: Displays detailed information about installed drivers.

title: Display Hotfixes
description: Lists all installed Windows hotfixes with installation dates.

title: Display BIOS Information
description: Displays BIOS information including version and serial number.

title: Display Motherboard Info
description: Displays motherboard information.

title: Display CPU Information
description: Displays detailed CPU information.

title: Display Memory Information
description: Displays RAM module information.

title: Display Disk Information
description: Displays information about installed disk drives.

title: Display Graphics Card Info
description: Displays graphics card information.

title: Display Network Adapters
description: Lists all network adapters with their MAC addresses.

title: Display Monitor Information
description: Displays monitor resolution information.

title: Display Battery Information
description: Generates a battery health report.

title: Check Power Settings
description: Displays current power settings.

title: Generate Energy Report
description: Generates an energy efficiency diagnostic report.

title: Display Sleep States
description: Displays available sleep states.

title: Create Restore Point
command: wmic.exe /Namespace:\\root\default Path SystemRestore Call CreateRestorePoint "My Restore Point", 100, 7
description: Creates a system restore point.

title: List Restore Points
description: Lists all available restore points.

title: Check Disk Space
description: Displays disk space information for all drives.

title: Display File System Info
description: Lists all drives in the system.

title: Display NTFS Info
description: Displays NTFS file system information for a drive.

title: Check File System Usage
description: Displays disk space usage for a volume.

title: Create Symbolic Link
description: Creates a symbolic link. Use '/d' for directory links, '/h' for hard links.

title: Take Ownership of File
description: Takes ownership of a file or folder.

title: Grant Full Control
description: Grants full control permissions to a user for a file or folder.

title: Remove Permissions
description: Removes all permissions for a user from a file or folder.

title: Reset Permissions
description: Resets permissions to default inheritance.

title: Display File Permissions
description: Displays permissions for a file or folder.

title: File Attributes
description: Displays or changes file attributes. Use '+r' for read-only, '+h' for hidden, '+s' for system.

title: Compare Files
description: Compares two files and displays the differences.

title: File Checksum
description: Calculates MD5 hash of a file. Replace MD5 with SHA1, SHA256, etc.

title: Display File Size
description: Lists files with their sizes in the current directory.

title: Find Large Files
description: Finds files larger than 10MB in the current directory and subdirectories.

title: Count Files
description: Counts the number of files in the current directory.

title: Count Directories
description: Counts the number of directories in the current directory.

title: Find Empty Files
description: Finds empty files in the current directory.

title: Find Duplicate Files
description: Finds duplicate file names (requires sort and uniq utilities).

title: Display File Extension Info
description: Displays the file type associated with a file extension.

title: Display Program for Extension
description: Displays the program used to open a file type.

title: Open File with Default Program
description: Opens a file with its default program.

title: Open Explorer
description: Opens Windows File Explorer.

title: Open Explorer to Path
description: Opens Windows File Explorer to a specific path.

title: Create Shortcut
description: Creates a shortcut to a file or program.

title: Display Clipboard Contents
description: Used with pipes to copy output to clipboard. Example: dir | clip

title: Print Text File
description: Prints a text file to the default printer.

title: Map Network Drive
description: Maps a network drive to a local drive letter.

title: Disconnect Network Drive
description: Disconnects a mapped network drive.

title: List Network Drives
description: Lists all mapped network drives.

title: Display Network Statistics by Process
description: Displays network statistics with executable names (requires admin).

title: Display Active Connections
description: Displays active connections in numerical form.

title: Display Ethernet Statistics
description: Displays Ethernet statistics.

title: Display Protocol Statistics
description: Displays protocol statistics (IP, ICMP, TCP, UDP).

title: Display Connection Timers
description: Displays active connections with process IDs and timers.

title: Flush ARP Cache
description: Flushes the ARP cache.

title: Reset TCP/IP Stack
description: Resets TCP/IP stack to default.

title: Reset Winsock Catalog
description: Resets Winsock catalog to default.

title: Display Firewall Status
description: Displays firewall status for all profiles.

title: Enable Firewall
command: netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state on
description: Enables Windows Firewall for all profiles.

title: Disable Firewall
command: netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state off
description: Disables Windows Firewall for all profiles.

title: Add Firewall Rule
command: netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Rule Name" dir=in action=allow protocol=TCP localport=80
description: Adds a new firewall rule.

title: Delete Firewall Rule
command: netsh advfirewall firewall delete rule name="Rule Name"
description: Deletes a firewall rule.

title: List Firewall Rules
command: netsh advfirewall firewall show rule name=all
description: Lists all firewall rules.

title: Display DNS Cache
description: Displays the contents of the DNS resolver cache.

title: Register DNS
description: Refreshes all DHCP leases and re-registers DNS names.

title: Display DHCP Info
description: Displays DHCP configuration information.

title: Display DNS Servers
description: Displays configured DNS servers.

title: Test DNS Resolution
description: Queries DNS servers for domain name resolution.

title: Display Route to Host
description: Traces route and provides packet loss statistics.

title: Display Network Adapter Details
description: Displays IP configuration for all network adapters.

title: Set Static IP Address
command: netsh interface ip set address "Local Area Connection" static <IP> <Subnet> <Gateway>
description: Sets a static IP address for a network adapter.

title: Set DHCP IP Address
command: netsh interface ip set address "Local Area Connection" dhcp
description: Sets network adapter to obtain IP automatically via DHCP.

title: Set DNS Server
command: netsh interface ip set dns "Local Area Connection" static <DNS_IP>
description: Sets a static DNS server for a network adapter.

title: Set DHCP DNS
command: netsh interface ip set dns "Local Area Connection" dhcp
description: Sets network adapter to obtain DNS automatically via DHCP.

title: Display Wireless Networks
description: Displays available wireless networks.

title: Display Wireless Profiles
description: Displays stored wireless network profiles.

title: Display Wireless Profile Password
command: netsh wlan show profile name="<profile_name>" key=clear
description: Displays wireless profile details including password (requires admin).

title: Connect to Wireless Network
description: Connects to a wireless network using a stored profile.

title: Disconnect from Wireless
description: Disconnects from the current wireless network.

title: Export Wireless Profile
description: Exports a wireless profile to an XML file.

title: Import Wireless Profile
description: Imports a wireless profile from an XML file.

title: Delete Wireless Profile
description: Deletes a wireless network profile.

title: Display Wireless Interface Info
description: Displays information about wireless interfaces.

title: Display Wireless Driver Info
description: Displays wireless adapter driver information.

title: Scan for Wireless Networks
description: Scans for available wireless networks.

title: Start Wireless Hosted Network
description: Starts a wireless hosted network (mobile hotspot).

title: Stop Wireless Hosted Network
description: Stops a wireless hosted network.

title: Set Hosted Network SSID
command: netsh wlan set hostednetwork mode=allow ssid=<SSID> key=<password>
description: Configures a wireless hosted network (mobile hotspot).

title: Show Hosted Network Settings
description: Displays wireless hosted network settings.

title: Display Bluetooth Devices
description: Lists Bluetooth devices using PowerShell.

title: Display USB Devices
description: Lists connected USB devices.

title: Display Printer Queue
description: Displays print jobs in the printer queue.

title: Clear Printer Queue
command: net stop spooler && net start spooler
description: Clears the print spooler queue by restarting the service.

title: List Installed Printers
description: Lists all installed printers.

title: Set Default Printer
command: wmic printer where name="<printer_name>" call setdefaultprinter
description: Sets a printer as the default printer.

title: Display Time Zone
description: Displays the current time zone.

title: List Time Zones
description: Lists all available time zones.

title: Change Time Zone
description: Changes the system time zone.

title: Display System Locale
description: Displays the system locale settings.

title: Display Keyboard Layout
description: Displays keyboard layout and input methods using PowerShell.

title: Display Screen Resolution
description: Displays current screen resolution.

title: Display Color Depth
description: Displays color depth using PowerShell.

title: Display Refresh Rate
description: Displays monitor refresh rate.

title: List Installed Software
description: Lists installed software (takes time to load).

title: Uninstall Software
command: wmic product where name="<software_name>" call uninstall
description: Uninstalls software by name.

title: List Windows Features
description: Lists Windows features and their state.

title: Enable Windows Feature
description: Enables a Windows feature.

title: Disable Windows Feature
description: Disables a Windows feature.

title: Check Windows Image Health
description: Scans Windows image for component store corruption.

title: Repair Windows Image
description: Repairs Windows image using Windows Update.

title: Check Disk for Bad Sectors
description: Locates bad sectors and recovers readable information.

title: Defragment Disk
description: Defragments a disk drive.

title: Optimize Disk (TRIM)
description: Optimizes an SSD (sends TRIM command).

title: Display Disk Defrag Analysis
description: Analyzes a disk and displays fragmentation report.

title: Check Disk Performance
description: Runs disk performance assessment.

title: Check System Performance
description: Runs full system performance assessment.

title: Display Performance Counters
description: Displays performance counter data.

title: List Performance Counters
description: Lists available performance counters.

title: Display Memory Usage
description: Displays physical memory usage.

title: Display Virtual Memory
description: Displays virtual memory (page file) usage.

title: Display CPU Usage
description: Displays current CPU usage percentage.

title: Display Disk Usage
description: Displays disk usage for all drives.

title: Display Network Usage
description: Displays network interface usage.

title: Monitor Process Resource Usage
command: wmic process where name="<process_name>" get workingsetsize,virtualsize
description: Displays memory usage for a specific process.

title: Display Startup Programs
description: Lists programs that start automatically.

title: Display Boot Configuration
description: Displays boot configuration data.

title: Set Default Boot Entry
description: Sets the current boot entry as default.

title: Display Boot Time
description: Displays when the system was last booted.

title: Display Last Shutdown Time
description: Displays the last shutdown time from event logs.

title: Display System Logs
description: Displays the last 5 system event log entries.

title: Display Application Logs
description: Displays the last 5 application event log entries.

title: Display Security Logs
description: Displays the last 5 security event log entries.

title: Clear Event Log
description: Clears the system event log (requires admin).

title: Export Event Log
description: Exports the system event log to a file.

title: Display Error Events
description: Displays the last 10 error events from system logs.

title: Display Warning Events
description: Displays the last 10 warning events from system logs.

title: Display Critical Events
description: Displays the last 10 critical events from system logs.

title: Query Specific Event ID
description: Displays events with a specific event ID.

title: Display Event Log Statistics
description: Displays statistics for the system event log.

title: List Event Logs
description: Lists all available event logs.

title: Display Log Properties
description: Displays properties of a specific event log.

title: Set Log Size
description: Sets the maximum size of an event log.

title: Archive Event Log
description: Archives an event log.

title: Display Performance Logs
description: Lists all performance counters that can be logged.

title: Start Performance Log
command: logman create counter <log_name> -o "<output_file>.blg" -c "\Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time" -f bin -v mmddhhmm
description: Creates a performance counter log.

title: Stop Performance Log
description: Stops a performance counter log.

title: Delete Performance Log
description: Deletes a performance counter log.

title: List Performance Logs
description: Lists all performance data collector sets.

title: Display Logman Details
description: Displays details of a specific performance log.

title: Update Performance Log
description: Updates a performance log with additional counters.

title: Start Trace Log
description: Starts a trace log.

title: Stop Trace Log
description: Stops a trace log.

title: Create Trace Log
description: Creates a kernel trace log.

title: Display Trace Providers
description: Lists all available trace providers.

title: Display Provider Details
description: Displays details of a specific trace provider.

title: Convert ETL to XML
description: Converts an ETL trace file to XML format.

title: Convert ETL to CSV
description: Converts an ETL trace file to CSV format.

title: Generate Trace Report
description: Generates a summary report from a trace file.

title: Display Trace Summary
description: Displays a summary of trace file contents.

title: List Trace Sessions
description: Lists active trace sessions.
